moves.5... Be7 6. d4 c5 7. c3 Nc6 8. b4 cxd4 9: White picks up a free pawn.
moves.10... Ne4 11. Nbd2 Bf5 12. Bb2 f6 13. ex: I definitely like Nb5 better.  Although black could simply move the rook, if he tries to trade queens NxR+, then RxQ.  But the real beauty is that white (temporarily) protects against Nc3, which will prove painful.
moves.20... Rxc6 21. Nh4: Rc1 would probably have been better.
White should avoid trades while down three points.
moves.27... Red6 28. Rc1: Now black will want to trade rooks.
Mm, definitely like 43. g5 better.  The black knight has to move, then Ph7 becomes a freebie (free pawn).  Actually, this isn't too bad either--NxN, KxR.  I guess it is a cheap pawn either way.
I like Pg5 better.  Even Pf5 has promise.
